location_id.description:
User Guidance: The unique key given to a unique Location.

ETL Conventions: Each instance of a Location in the source data should be assigned this unique key.

address_1.description: User Guidance: This is the first line of the address.

address_2.description: User Guidance: This is the second line of the address

zip.description: ETL Conventions: Zip codes are handled as strings of up to 9 characters length. For US addresses, these represent either a 3-digit abbreviated Zip code as provided by many sources for patient protection reasons, the full 5-digit Zip or the 9-digit (ZIP + 4) codes. Unless for specific reasons analytical methods should expect and utilize only the first 3 digits. For international addresses, different rules apply.

location_source_value.description: ETL Conventions: Put the verbatim value for the location here, as it shows up in the source.

country_concept_id.description: User Guidance: The Concept Id representing the country. Values should conform to the [Geography](https://athena.ohdsi.org/search-terms/terms?domain=Geography&standardConcept=Standard&page=1&pageSize=15&query=&boosts) domain.

country_source_value.description: User Guidance: The name of the country.

latitude.description: ETL Conventions: Must be between -90 and 90.

longitude.description: ETL Conventions: Must be between -180 and 180.
